com.pi4j.io.gpio

Class OdroidGpioProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pi4j.io.gpio.GpioProviderBase
      • com.pi4j.io.gpio.WiringPiGpioProviderBase
        • com.pi4j.io.gpio.OdroidGpioProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GpioProvider, AnalogInputListener, GpioInterruptListener, EventListener

    public class OdroidGpioProvider
extends WiringPiGpioProviderBase
implements GpioProvider, GpioInterruptListener, AnalogInputListener
    Odroid-C1/C1+/XU4 GpioProvider implementation.
    Author:
    Robert Savage (http://www.savagehomeautomation.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getAnalogInputPollingRate

        public static int getAnalogInputPollingRate()
        Get the analog input monitor polling rate in milliseconds. This is the rate at which the internal analog input monitoring thread will poll for analog input value changes and dispatch analog input value change event for subscribed analog input listeners. (The DEFAULT polling rate is 50 milliseconds)
        Returns:
        polling rate in milliseconds

      • getAnalogInputListenerChangeThreshold

        public static double getAnalogInputListenerChangeThreshold()
        Get the analog input listener change value threshold. This is the threshold delta value that the internal analog input monitoring thread must cross before dispatching a new analog input value change event. The analog input value must change in excess of this defined value from the last event dispatched before dispatching a new analog input value change event. NOTE: This threshold value is a valuable tool to filter/limit the analog input value change events that your program may receive. (The DEFAULT change threshold value is 0)
        Returns:
        change threshold value (delta)

      • setAnalogInputPollingRate

        public static void setAnalogInputPollingRate(int milliseconds)
        Set the analog input monitor polling rate in milliseconds. This is the rate at which the internal analog input monitoring thread will poll for analog input value changes and dispatch analog input value change event for subscribed analog input listeners. NOTE: Be aware that lower polling rates can impact/increase the CPU usage for your application. (The DEFAULT polling rate is 50 milliseconds)
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - polling rate in milliseconds; this value must be a positive number else a default polling rate is used

      • setAnalogInputListenerChangeThreshold

        public static void setAnalogInputListenerChangeThreshold(double threshold)
        Set the analog input listener change value threshold. This is the threshold delta value that the internal analog input monitoring thread must cross before dispatching a new analog input value change event. The analog input value must change in excess of this defined value from the last event dispatched before dispatching a new analog input value change event. NOTE: This threshold value is a valuable tool to filter/limit the analog input value change events that your program may receive. (The DEFAULT change threshold value is 0)
        Parameters:
        threshold - change threshold value; this value must be zero or greater. If the threshold value is set to zero, then any change in value will dispatch a new analog input value event.
